column5: Hey guys,  As I have a young family and wife who's spent a good part of the past few years being preggo haha I've always kept an eye on the guide to eating Ontario sportfish.  They've gone and created an online interactive version which is pretty cool.  Thought I'd pass the link along.  Cheers, Ryan  http://www.ene.gov.on.ca/environment/en/mapping/sportfish/index.htm
hey don't worry I just found out that my beloved bluegill are laced with Mercury!    SO STAY AWAY FROM 'EM and leave them for me and the kids to catch!
Thanks for posting.  That is much easier than going through the PDF version!
Yalls gots to catch 'em, if yalls wants to eats 'ems.  Just sayin'.   Thanks for the link.
going to be intresting to see what happens to people that have charters and what people keep, seeing they seem not to be good to eat
Thanks this is useful. Some spots are off-target though.
